Package io.opentelemetry.metrics

Interface CounterLong

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Metric<CounterLong.TimeSeries>
    @ThreadSafe
public interface CounterLong
extends Metric<CounterLong.TimeSeries>
    Counter metric, to report instantaneous measurement of a long value. Cumulative values can go up or stay the same, but can never go down. Cumulative values cannot be negative.

    Example 1: Create a Cumulative with default labels. 

    
 class YourClass {

   private static final Meter meter = Metrics.getMeter();
   private static final MetricRegistry metricRegistry = meter.metricRegistryBuilder().build();

   List<LabelKey> labelKeys = Arrays.asList(LabelKey.create("Name", "desc"));

   CounterLong cumulative = metricRegistry.addLongCumulative("processed_jobs",
                       "Processed jobs", "1", labelKeys);

   // It is recommended to keep a reference of a TimeSeries.
   CounterLong.TimeSeries defaultTimeSeries = cumulative.getDefaultTimeSeries();

   void doWork() {
      // Your code here.
      defaultPoint.add(10);
   }

 }

    Example 2: You can also use labels (keys and values) to track different types of metric. 

    
 class YourClass {

   private static final Meter meter = Metrics.getMeter();
   private static final MetricRegistry metricRegistry = meter.metricRegistryBuilder().build();

   List<LabelKey> labelKeys = Arrays.asList(LabelKey.create("Name", "desc"));
   List<LabelValue> labelValues = Arrays.asList(LabelValue.create("Inbound"));

   CounterLong cumulative = metricRegistry.addLongCumulative("processed_jobs",
                       "Processed jobs", "1", labelKeys);

   // It is recommended to keep a reference of a TimeSeries.
   CounterLong.TimeSeries inboundTimeSeries = cumulative.getOrCreateTimeSeries(labelValues);

   void doSomeWork() {
      // Your code here.
      inboundPoint.set(15);
   }

 }
    Since:
    0.1.0

      static interface  CounterLong.TimeSeries
      The value of a single point in the Cumulative.TimeSeries.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      CounterLong.TimeSeries getDefaultTimeSeries()
      Returns a TimeSeries for a metric with all labels not set (default label value).
      CounterLong.TimeSeries getOrCreateTimeSeries​(List<LabelValue> labelValues)
      Creates a TimeSeries and returns a TimeSeries if the specified labelValues is not already associated with this gauge, else returns an existing TimeSeries.

      • Methods inherited from interface io.opentelemetry.metrics.Metric

        clear, removeTimeSeries, setCallback

    • Method Detail

      • getOrCreateTimeSeries

        CounterLong.TimeSeries getOrCreateTimeSeries​(List<LabelValue> labelValues)
        Description copied from interface: Metric
        Creates a TimeSeries and returns a TimeSeries if the specified labelValues is not already associated with this gauge, else returns an existing TimeSeries.

        It is recommended to keep a reference to the TimeSeries instead of always calling this method for every operations.

        Specified by:
        getOrCreateTimeSeries in interface Metric<CounterLong.TimeSeries>
        Parameters:
        labelValues - the list of label values. The number of label values must be the same to that of the label keys passed to Metric.Builder.setLabelKeys(List).
        Returns:
        a TimeSeries the value of single gauge.

      • getDefaultTimeSeries

        CounterLong.TimeSeries getDefaultTimeSeries()
        Description copied from interface: Metric
        Returns a TimeSeries for a metric with all labels not set (default label value).
        Specified by:
        getDefaultTimeSeries in interface Metric<CounterLong.TimeSeries>
        Returns:
        a TimeSeries for a metric with all labels not set (default label value).
